column4: why does this script give me the error: Missing argument to -exec
find . -size +210c -exec ls -l {}
why does this script give me the error: Missing argument to -exec
find . -size +210c -exec ls -l {}
find . -size +210c -exec ls -l {} \;
that command isn't 'piping' the results because I'm getting files less than 210bytes
that doesn't seem right to u?
you are?
yea
its giving all the files in the directory
well yeah, directories are typically 4096 bytes by default
and you're asking it to 'find' everything in whatever it finds
hmmm so how to modify? i tried taking out the .
find . -maxdepth 0 -size +210c -exec ls -l {} \;
thats not right :D
doesn't work
oh you're right, it doesn't traverse..
heh so you're not sure alright
well, i was reading the manpage :)
thx anyway I"ll work on it later gotta go :)
cheers, good luck
